result.execSummary:
Bradley G Rietmann was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Bradley G Rietmann was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bradley G Rietmann

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant, Bradley G Rietmann, in custody, appeared with Attorney Donna Burger.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew John Maki.  Defendant in custody.  Kim Silvius - Clerk
(1:24)
State - deft will waive extradition
Burger - explained the rights and has viewed extradition
Deft - will waive extradition & waives attorney
Burger - will sit here but is not representing the deft

COURT:  Approves Extradition and signs in court
